Signed by Governor Inslee on March 13, 2024, Senate Bill 5935 expands the definition of non-competition covenants and limits the use of non-solicitation agreements to only those that prohibit employe rom accepting business from current customers is considered a void non-competition agreem th an attorney before signing the agreement.If an employee wins a lawsuit against their employer over a non-compete or non-solicitation agreement, the employer must pay the employeeâs attorney fees.Washington DCThe D.C. Ban on Noncompete Agreements Amendment Act of 2020 took effect on April 1, 2022, prohibiting employers from requiring or requesting non-compete clauses in employee contracts. The Act also
laws.suggestion: Remove the non-compete clause entirely as it is restricted under Washington law for agreements made after the effective date of Senate Bill 5935. Use only confidentiality and trade secret protection clauses instead, such as: "Employee agrees to maintain the confidentiality of all trade secrets and proprietary information of the Company." Ensure any existing non-competes are reviewed for compliance with the new law.

Effective date: Sept. 1, 2019
Employers affected: All employers
Employers may not refuse to hire,  an Resource Management will introduce an updated application for state jobs that eliminat
laws.suggestion: Remove salary history questions. Replace with: 'Please provide your salary expectations for this role' to comply with Washington law, which prohibits employers from inquiring about an applicant's salary history. This alternative language focuses on the applicant's expectations rather than their past salary.

review_notes.next_steps: Verify statute citations and effective dates
